text: [Music]
Hey everyone, welcome back to my
channel. This is Dorian. I'm a teacher
of English and today we're going to talk
about how to write complex sentences. As
you know in your writing, you're you're
asked to write complex sentences and
this is really really important for your
IELTS marking. The thing is that most of
you try to write in a complex way, but
this eventually comes against you
because you end up making too many
mistakes. So if you're not 100% sure
that what you're writing is correct,
then better not to write it at all.
Better be simple than sorry, right?
However, today I'm going to show you how
to write complex sentences and be
correct at the same time. First things
first, what do we mean by saying a
simple sentence? A simple sentence is a
sentence that consists of the subject,
the person that does something, and a
verb. For example, Mary is happy. Mary,
the subject is the verb. Another
example, the dog ate his food. The dog,
the subject, and ate the verb. Okay,
that's it. These are just simple
sentences that are made up by a verb and
a subject. These sentences can totally
stand on their own. That's why we call
them independent because they don't need
anything else. Now, a very important
punctuation tip. When you have two or
more simple sentences together,
you never use a comma between them. For
example, if you have
Mary is happy, her mom is happy,
everyone is happy. These three sentences
are simple sentences. Okay? You can
never connect them with a. This is
wrong. Instead, we use a semicolon
between them. So we will have Mary's
happy
semicolon her mom is happy
semicolon everyone is happy. Okay. Uh
keep that in mind not only for your
IEL's writing but also for your academic
studies later. Now what is a compound
sentence? Again nothing to confuse you.
A compound sentence consists of two or
more simple sentences, independent
sentences together, but this time they
are not connected with a semicolon, but
they are connected with another linking
word. For example, Mary is happy and her
mom is happy. Another example, her mom
baked a cake, but it was not tasty.
These connecting words that connect two
simple sentences together in order to
form a compound sentence are called
funboys in grammar uh because it is very
easy for you to remember them in this
way. For example, if you put the word
funboys in a vertical way, then you have
for and nor, but
yet and so. Of course, there are more
linking words than you can use, but
these are the most commonly used and it
is very easy for you to remember them in
this way. Now, what is a complex
sentence? A complex sentence consists of
a simple sentence again and a sentence
that cannot stand on its own. That is a
dependent sentence. Okay? For example,
because the cake isn't tasty, Mary isn't
happy. As you can see in this example,
Mary is a h is unhappy can totally stand
on its own. But the dependent sentence
because the cake is not tasty cannot
stand on on its own. It doesn't make
sense. It needs
the simple sentence in order to make
sense. Right? So in a complex sentence
simple and dependent sentences are
connected together with a linking words.
These linking words are even though,
although, unless,
uh, if, etc., etc., etc. There are
numerous of them. So, let's see another
example. Even though the cake is tasty,
Mary is still unhappy. Now, let's use
what we've just learned in order to make
IEL's task two level examples.
So, we will take random simple sentences
together. These could be your notes. For
example, prisons are overcrowded.
Prisons do not seem to work. People who
are released do not seem to be properly
rehabilitated.
Uh they usually end up being locked up
again. Okay. Okay. Now, we can take
these simple sentences and we can make a
single complex sentence. For example,
prisons are overcrowded and they do not
seem to work as people who are released
do not seem to be properly rehabilitated
since they usually end up being locked
up again. So, we took our random notes,
our simple sentences, and we formed a
single complex sentence. We connected
the first two sentences with the word
and and we made a compound sentence and
then we used connecting words and made
the other two sentences dependent. This
is very useful when you have written
down ideas in your notes with reasons
and examples and you don't know how to
connect them all together in a single
paragraph and of course in a more
complex way.
Okay, that's it for today. Thank you
very much for watching. I hope it helps.
If this is your first time here, I would
